sen.j: 藤原 忠雅（ふじわら の ただまさ、大治4年（1129年） - 建久4年8月26日 (旧暦)（1193年9月23日））は平安時代末期から鎌倉時代初期にかけての公家。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Tadamasa (1129 - September 23, 1193) was a court noble who lived in the late Heian Period and the early Kamakura Period.
FUJIWARA no Tadamasa (1129 - September 23, 1193) was a court noble who lived in the late Heian Period and the early Kamakura Period.
FUJIWARA no Tadamasa (1129 - September 30, 1193) was a court noble who lived in the late Heian period and the early Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: ユリウス→グレゴリオ暦に修正、Period→periodとしました。

sen.j: 中納言藤原忠宗の次男。
sen.e: He was the second son of FUJIWARA no Tadamune..
He was the second son of FUJIWARA no Tadamune..
He was the second son of Chunagon (vice-councilor of state) FUJIWARA no Tadamune.

sen.j: 父忠宗は藤原北家藤原頼通の子藤原師実の次子藤原家忠の長子である。
sen.e: His father, Tadamune was the first son of FUJIWARA no Ietada, who was the second son of FUJIWARA no Morozane who was a child of FUJIWARA no Yorimichi of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.
His father, Tadamune was the first son of FUJIWARA no Ietada, who was the second son of FUJIWARA no Morozane who was a child of FUJIWARA no Yorimichi of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.
His father, Tadamune was the first son of FUJIWARA no Ietada, who was the second son of FUJIWARA no Morozane who was a child of FUJIWARA no Yorimichi of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.

sen.j: 母は院の近臣である参議藤原家保の娘。
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of FUJIWARA no Ieyasu, who was a trusted vassal of the In (retired emperor).
His mother was a daughter of FUJIWARA no Ieyasu, who was a trusted vassal of the In (retired emperor).
His mother was a daughter of FUJIWARA no Ieyasu, who was Sangi (Royal Advisor) and a trusted vassal of the In (retired emperor).

sen.j: 忠雅は幼少時に父を亡くし、母方の叔父藤原家成に引き取られて育った。
sen.e: Tadamasa lost his father while he was very young and he was took on and brought up by his maternal uncle, FUJIWARA no Ienari.
Tadamasa lost his father while he was very young and he was took on and brought up by his maternal uncle, FUJIWARA no Ienari.
Tadamasa lost his father while he was very young and he was took on and brought up by his maternal uncle, FUJIWARA no Ienari.

sen.j: 家成の引き立てもあり、院の近臣として順調に出世を重ねる。
sen.e: Partly because of backup by Ienari, he was repeatedly promoted as a trusted vassal of the In.
Partly because of backup by Ienari, he was repeatedly promoted as a trusted vassal of the In.
Partly because of backup by Ienari, he was repeatedly promoted as a trusted vassal of the In.

sen.j: また、「悪左府」として有名な藤原頼長とも非常に親しい関係にあった。
sen.e: Furthermore, he was very close with FUJIWARA no Yorinaga, who was famous as "akusafu (powerful Sadaijin)."
Furthermore, he was very close with FUJIWARA no Yorinaga, who was famous as "akusafu (powerful Sadaijin)."
Furthermore, he was very close with FUJIWARA no Yorinaga, who was famous as 'akusafu' (powerful sadaijin, or minister of the left).

sen.j: 力をつける平清盛にも近づき、息子藤原兼雅と清盛の娘を結婚させる事に成功する。
sen.e: He also approached TAIRA no Kiyomori, who had been getting his power, and succeeded to make his son, FUJIWARA no Kanemasa, marry a daughter of Kiyomori.
He also approached by TAIRA no Kiyomori, who had been getting his power, and succeeded to make his son, FUJIWARA no Kanemasa, marry a daughter of Kiyomori.
sen.cmt: Robert: "Who had been getting his power" makes no sense.
sen.e: He also approached by TAIRA no Kiyomori, who had been strengthening his influence, and succeeded to make his son, FUJIWARA no Kanemasa, marry a daughter of Kiyomori.
sen.cmt: who had been getting his power→who had been strengthening his influenceとしました。

sen.j: 仁安 (日本)3年（1168年）5月17日、辞職した清盛の後任として太政大臣就任。
sen.e: On May 17, 1168, he assumed the position of Daijodaijin (Grand Minister) as a successor to Kiyomori, who had resigned.
On May 17, 1168, he assumed the position of Daijodaijin (Grand Minister) as a successor to Kiyomori, who had resigned.
On May 17, 1168, he assumed the position of Daijodaijin (Grand Minister) as a successor to Kiyomori, who had resigned.

sen.j: 嘉応2年（1170年）6月6日間で勤める。
sen.e: 嘉応2年(1170年)6月6日間で勤める。
嘉応2年(1170年)6月6日間で勤める。
He worked as Daijodaijin until June 6, 1170.
sen.cmt: ウェブ上で確認したところ、「6月6日間で勤める」→「6月6日まで勤める」となっていたためこちらに基づき訳出しました。

sen.j: 承安 (日本)元年（1171年）には娘を後任の太政大臣で後に関白になる藤原基房に嫁がせる。
sen.e: In 1171, he made one of his daughter marry FUJIWARA no Motofusa, who succeeded the position of Daijodaijin and later became Kanpaku (chief advisor to the emperor).

sen.j: このように忠雅は、巧みな婚姻政策によって平氏政権の下で昇進し、後の花山院家の発展の礎を築いた。
sen.e: As seen in the above descriptions, through his well-considered marriage strategies, Tadamasa was promoted smoothly un the government by the TAIRA clan and established the basis of future development of the Kasannoin family.
